general_advisory: Beushaning in direct seeded rice should be completed utilizing the recent rainfall & maintain a thin film of water in the field. Farmers are advised to continue transplanting rice using rain water/canal water/pond as good amount of rainfall is expected in the coming days. Drain out excess water from rice nurseries & jute fields.

advisory: Considering the anticipated rainfall farmer should start transplanting of rice after nursery treatment with Granular insecticide like Cartap hydrochloride (4G) or Fipronil 0.3g. Plant 2 to 3 seedlings/hill at shallow depth with appropriate spacing. Apply pre-emergence weedicide at 3 to 4 days after transplanting.

Excess water in the field decreases the quality of jute. Drain excess water from the field. Cut the branches during inter-crop to enhance growth. Recent rain will increase weed population in jute, apply appropriate herbicides. Rainy weather is favorable for insect pests, control them with recommended pesticides.
Remove borer affected tillers and late formed tillers. Tie cane shoots together. Use foliar spray to control early shot borer.
Drain out water from the field to prevent wilting. Use appropriate pesticides and fungicides to control pests.
To control Fruit and shoot borer in Brinjal and Okra, use Neem based pesticide and alternate sprays.
Stock Carp in the recommended ratio for better growth. Use specified feed and supplements to increase benefits. Vaccinate animals against common diseases.
